metadata.title: CVE-2014-9911 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the ures_getByKeyWithFallback function in common/uresbund.cpp in International Components for Unicode (ICU) before 54.1 for C/C++ allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted uloc_getDisplayName call.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2014-9911` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu4
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu4
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu4
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu4
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu4
xul-ext-lightning - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu4
No subscription required

notes.note: jdstrand> this was fixed in 54.0.1. chromium-browser has 56 now chrisccoulson> firefox has 56 at least since Firefox 50, and Thunderbird has 56 since at least 45.3 oxide has had 56.1 since at least 1.17

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu4').
